description.plain: Rita Ora is an Albanian-British singer/songwriter and actress who rose to prominence with her 2012 debut album ORA. Since then she has maintained her appearances on the pop charts and has also branched out into other ventures like acting and fashion endorsements. After a long legal dispute with her previous label Roc Nation, her second album Phoenix  was released through Atlantic Records UK in 2018. It charted internationally in over twenty countries and peaked at #11 in the UK.

body.plain: Rita Ora is an Albanian-British singer/songwriter and actress who rose to prominence with her 2012 debut album ORA. It charted internationally in over twenty countries and peaked at #11 in the UK.

description.plain:
“Girls” is the third official single from Rita Ora’s upcoming album. The song tackles themes of female empowerment, self-love, and bisexuality.

The song was met with backlash initiated by lesbian icon Hayley Kiyoko – it was accused of being “tone-deaf” and “fueling the male gaze”. Ora has since issued an apology via Twitter.

Initially, Rita debuted a version of the song live at the BBC Radio 1’s Big Weekend on May 28, 2017 with fellow British artists, RAYE and Charli XCX. The three previously collaborated on the VIP mix of Charli’s “After the Afterparty.”

In a November interview with The Big Top 40, Rita confirmed Bebe Rexha and Charli XCX as collaborators on the track. Bebe then teased a third featured artist. In December, this was leaked by ThatGrapeJuice to be Cardi B, which was later confirmed by Rita herself as she unveiled the release date along with an alternate promotional cover art for the song two days prior to the song’s release.

songs.embed_content: Read “Girls” by Rita Ora on Genius

songs.title: Your Song

description.plain:
The song is an uptempo, radio-friendly record. Three years after her greatest hit single “I Will Never Let You Down," British singer and actress Rita Ora has returned.

“Your Song” is the first single to Phoenix. The song is written by Ed Sheeran and Steve Mac and has Sheeran as backing vocals.

songs.title: Anywhere

description.plain:
“Anywhere” is the second single off of her second album Phoenix. According to Ora herself, “Anywhere” is a love song. Rita explained more about the song by saying:

“Anywhere” is super important with everything going on, The core of this song was written in L.A., and I really wanted to get out of there. I felt too still and that every day was the same for me, so I wrote a song called “Anywhere” basically saying, ‘Take me anywhere, anywhere away from here.’ We turned that into ‘Anywhere away with you,’ and it became this incredible love song."

“Anywhere” was written by Alesso, Ali Tamposi, Andrew Wotman, Brian Lee, Sir Nolan, and Ora.

“Anywhere” is the second single off of her second album Phoenix. According to Ora herself, “Anywhere” is a love song. Rita explained more about the song by saying:

“Anywhere” is super important with everything going on, The core of this song was written in L.A., and I really wanted to get out of there. I felt too still and that every day was the same for me, so I wrote a song called “Anywhere” basically saying, ‘Take me anywhere, anywhere away from here.’ We turned that into ‘Anywhere away with you,’ and it became this incredible love song."

“Anywhere” was written by Alesso, Ali Tamposi, Andrew Wotman, Brian Lee, Sir Nolan, and Ora.
